DOC.brief_summary: This pilot study evaluate feasibility impact father-focused childhood obesity prevention program paternal food-related parenting practice , mealtime behavior father/child nutrition physical activity behavior . Half participant ( low-income father child dyad ) receive intervention immediately half participant serve wait-list control group receive intervention later date .
DOC.brief_title: A Nutrition Parenting Program Fathers Their Pre-school Age Children
DOC.detailed_description: All participant ( low-income father child dyad ) receive 8 session ( 2 hours/session ) ( DAD ) include community-based , hands-on , nutrition parent education intervention between-session technology enhancement . Dyads randomly assign within group 10 DAD wait-list control group ( DELAY ) . Assessments conduct pre , post 1 month post include subset data cohabit mother assess moderate influence outcomes .
DOC.criteria: `` Father '' eligible federal food assistance relate program ( e.g . SNAP ) live area > 30 % poverty Having least one preschool age child ( age 35 year old ) At least 18 year age able speak English No presence interaction child meal snack time .
